He has been too good. Not yet. Not yet. He had said he was sorry. There was a slow exhale - letting out a breath she had not realised she was holding. Ignore the apology wrapped in an insult, focus on the former. Please. Pull yourself together. You can get out of this. You can fix this. You have to. She unclenched her jaw. The tone slid back to neutrality. "I understand your concerns, Captain, and I appreciate you raising them with me. I hope that we can 'make these extremes meet' in the future." Was it good enough? No. Was it all she had? Yes. The anger had vanished, the tension lost to exhaustion - but no clarify came with it at all. Nothing. Still nothing. Always nothing.
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 08-Aug-20 11:38 PM
He had been left there, watching as the energy around them melted away from stricken anger at each other to leveled once more. Kun himself was at a lost. People were.. complex, difficult, hard to read. In truth, he didn't know her, he didn't know where she came from, and her certainly didn't know what she's dealt with. It made speaking to her horribly difficult - not in the sense that he was intimated or scared he just didn't know what his boundaries were with what he said. A single hand ran through his hair before falling to rest on the back of his neck. Divines, tell him what to do, something, anything. The smallest of wishes, of prayers, to know how to handle all of this. Just, don't reignite anything. Whatever A'aehrel needed to do, was something by herself. A personal matter. "Me.. Me too, and I'll-" How was he supposed to phrase this "-I will try my very best to get a better understanding of yours." Was this how he was supposed to end it? How he was supposed to stop? Damn it. "I'll speak with you soon, thank you" He couldn't return back to his normal voicing. Too thrown off, rocky ground. Letting his hands back to his sides, he pushed the chair into the desk. There was a single glance spared towards the Romulan-Vulcan before turning right around. (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 09-Aug-20 12:30 AM

She needed clarity, she needed clarification, and she needed it before everything came to a head and she did something that she regretted. However, the zeta particles we detected are harming them. Killing them, even. And they're sourced from the lab we found."
